name: ReadOperations
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
ReadOperations
description:
ReadOperations

Collection of read rows apis.

  • Sample row key
  • Read row
  • Read rows

methods.name: sample_row_keys
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
ReadOperations#sample_row_keys
methods.description:
Read sample row keys.

Returns a sample of row keys in the table. The returned row keys will delimit contiguous sections of the table of approximately equal size, which can be used to break up the data for distributed tasks like mapreduces.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new
table = bigtable.table("my-instance", "my-table")

table.sample_row_keys.each do |sample_row_key|
  p sample_row_key.key # user00116
  p sample_row_key.offset # 805306368
end

returns.description: Yield block for each processed SampleRowKey.

methods.name: read_rows
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
ReadOperations#read_rows
methods.description:
Read rows

Streams back the contents of all requested rows in key order, optionally applying the same Reader filter to each. read_rows, row_ranges and filter if not specified, reads from all rows.

See Google::Cloud::Bigtable::RowFilter for filter types.

examples.caption: Read with Limit
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new
table = bigtable.table("my-instance", "my-table")

table.read_rows(limit: 10).each do |row|
  puts row
end

examples.caption: Read using row keys
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new
table = bigtable.table("my-instance", "my-table")

table.read_rows(keys: ["user-1", "user-2"]).each do |row|
  puts row
end

examples.caption: Read using row ranges
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new
table = bigtable.table("my-instance", "my-table")

range =  table.row_range.between("user-1", "user-100")

table.read_rows(ranges: range).each do |row|
  puts row
end

examples.caption: Read using filter
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new
table = bigtable.table("my-instance", "my-table")

filter = table.filter.key("user-*")
# OR
# filter = Google::Cloud::Bigtable::RowFilter.key("user-*")

table.read_rows(filter: filter).each do |row|
  puts row
end

examples.caption: Read using filter with limit
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new
table = bigtable.table("my-instance", "my-table")

filter = table.filter.key("user-*")
# OR
# filter = Google::Cloud::Bigtable::RowFilter.key("user-*")

table.read_rows(filter: filter, limit: 10).each do |row|
  puts rowow
end

params.name: keys
params.description: List of row keys to be read. Optional.

params.name: ranges
params.description: Row ranges array or single range. Optional.

params.name: filter
params.description:
The filter to apply to the contents of the specified row(s). If unset,
reads the entries of each row. Optional.

params.name: limit
params.description:
Limit number of read rows count. Optional.
The read will terminate after committing to N rowsâ€™ worth of results.
The default (zero) is to return all results.

returns.description: Array of row or yield block for each processed row.

examples.caption: Read row
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new
table = bigtable.table("my-instance", "my-table")

row = table.read_row("user-1")

examples.caption: Read row
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new
table = bigtable.table("my-instance", "my-table")

filter = Google::Cloud::Bigtable::RowFilter.cells_per_row(3)

row = table.read_row("user-1", filter: filter)

params.name: filter
params.description: The filter to apply to the contents of the specified row. Optional.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new
table = bigtable.table("my-instance", "my-table")

range = table.value_range
range.from("abc")
range.to("xyz")

# OR
range = table.new_value_range.from("abc").to("xyz")

examples.caption: With exclusive from range
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new
table = bigtable.table("my-instance", "my-table")

range = table.new_value_range.from("abc", inclusive: false).to("xyz")

require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new
table = bigtable.table("my-instance", "my-table")

range = table.column_range("test-family")
range.from("abc")
range.to("xyz")

# OR
range = table.new_column_range("test-family").from("key-1").to("key-5")

examples.caption: With exclusive from range
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new
table = bigtable.table("my-instance", "my-table")

range = table.new_column_range("test-family").from("key-1", inclusive: false).to("key-5")

require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new
table = bigtable.table("my-instance", "my-table")

range = table.row_range
range.from("abc")
range.to("xyz")

# OR
range = table.new_row_range.from("key-1").to("key-5")

examples.caption: With exclusive from range
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new
table = bigtable.table("my-instance", "my-table")

range = table.new_row_range.from("key-1", inclusive: false).to("key-5")

require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new
table = bigtable.table("my-instance", "my-table")

filter = table.filter.key("user-*")
